body:
@robertmeta @dsymonds 
Say I just use the latest two versions inside my projects/libraries that depend on them. But I want to support the last 10 versions for other users. I have my unit tests that make sure my API does not break within a major version. Why should I need to have 10 working copies when I just could switch branches and only actively use 2 versions?

@dsymonds 
> You are proposing to integrate knowledge about VCSes into the go tool at a level that undermines that simplicity

Nowhere I propose to integrate any knowledge about VCSes. Please show me where.
What is not simple about the "alternative" implementation:

>    1. Make go build and go install ignore the canonical path if no package name is given.

I think this is what everybody expects, since when I am inside the package to develop and run `go build`I just expect it to work regardless of how my package is represented to the outside world (i.e. vanity).
